com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.container

Class ArrayAsUnmodifiableList<TValue>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingObject
      • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingCollection<E>
        • com.google.common.collect.ForwardingList<TValue>
          • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.container.BaseFixedSizeForwardingList<TValue>
            • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.container.UnmodifiableForwardingList<TValue>
              • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.container.ArrayAsUnmodifiableList<TValue>
  • Type Parameters:
    TValue - element type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<TValue>, Collection<TValue>, List<TValue>

    @FullyTested
public final class ArrayAsUnmodifiableList<TValue>
extends UnmodifiableForwardingList<TValue>
    This class has the same effect as: Collections.unmodifiableList(Arrays.asList(arr)). This collection is unmodifiable, so no access is provided to the underlying array.

    The class constructor is private. Instead, use static method referenceTo(Object[]).

    This class is closely related to ArrayAsFixedSizeList and ArrayAsImmutableList. To understand the difference between unmodifiable and immutable, learn more here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8892350/immutable-vs-unmodifiable-collection

    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    referenceTo(Object[]), UnmodifiableForwardingList, Collections.unmodifiableList(List), Arrays.asList(Object[]), ArrayAsFixedSizeList, ArrayAsImmutableList
